type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: ACQUISITION OF LANDS FOR PUBLIC PURPOSES ACT under Interpretation. 2.  In this Act  the Court means the High Court, and includes any judge thereof;   land includes all land whether covered with water or otherwise, together with any buildings and erections thereon, and, where that meaning may be inferred, any right therein;  the Registrar means the Registrar of the Court.

type.title: Claim exceeding $500 may be referred to magistrate.
type.context: ACQUISITION OF LANDS FOR PUBLIC PURPOSES ACT under Claim exceeding $500 may be referred to magistrate. 27.  When it does not appear to the Commissioner of Lands that the land claimed exceeds five hundred dollars in value, the magistrate of the district  in which the land is situate, upon the application of the Commissioner of Lands, may summon the other party to appear before him at a time and place to be named in the summons, and upon the appearance of that party, or in his absence upon proof of the due service of the summons, the magistrate may give all Interest on land bonds  LAWS OF GUYANA Acquisition of Lands for Public Purposes Cap. 62:05 15                               c. 3:05      Claim exceeding $500 may be referred to magistrate.  [4 of 1972]        directions and exercise all or any of the powers in regard to the assessment and award which the Court may exercise under this Act:  Provided that  (a)     the  party  so  summoned,  at  any  time  before  the magistrate has given his decision, may apply to the Court in chambers by motion to have the proceedings removed to the Court  and thereupon the Court may order them to be so removed, and the order shall be served upon the magistrate, who shall  immediately transmit all documents of every description in his possession and custody to the Registrar; and  (b)    in  that  case  the  party  having  the  proceedings  so removed shall only be entitled to the costs as laid down by the Summary Jurisdiction (Magistrates) Act, or any order under it relating to fees, unless the compensation awarded by the Court exceeds five hundred dollars.

type.name: section
type.title: Assaulting or obstructing officers.
type.context: ACQUISITION OF LANDS FOR PUBLIC PURPOSES ACT under Assaulting or obstructing officers. 28.  Anyone who assaults or beats or obstructs  (a)  the marshal, bailiff, or any of his assistants, in the execution of his duty under this Act; or  (b)   the Commissioner of Lands, or other person authorised as  aforesaid, or his workmen, servants, or agents, in the execution of his or their duty under this Act, or aids, or aids or abets any person in so doing,  shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine of forty-eight thousand seven  hundred  and  fifty  dollars,  and  in  default  of  payment  to imprisonment for six months.
